page.title: 18State Education in Whitby.
page.content: There is only one state run{Nursery,} situated on the East Side of Whitby which takes children aged 3 to 5 years.There are 5 town{Primary Schools which admit children up to the age of eleven.The natural division of Whitby by the River Esk determines the secondary school that children attend when they leave their primary school. East Whitby is served by{Eskdale {School}and West Whitby by{Caedmon {School.}Both are 11 to 14 comprehensives. 14 out of town schools also feed into one of the two comprehensives.Entrance to{Whitby {School}occurs when pupils leave the comprehensives.The leaving age is 16+. All{higher education}has to be sought outside the area.Children with special needs have to travel to Scarborough.
